text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with a food wish first i think this
is the first time we've used rhubarb so
we're gonna make a delicious traditional
rhubarb crisp and it starts with this
rhubarb beautiful color what's gonna
call it red it's not really red what
color is that
and just to fake you out I actually use
three ribs but pictured here just two
ribs
you're gonna trim off the tops and
bottoms just like celery we're gonna cut
it in half and then in like three long
sticks and then just take your knife and
slice across it in you don't know
quarter-inch pieces just dice it up
nothing complicated
there we go that's three ribs diced up I
had a half a pint of strawberries
leftover so I decided to add that you
can do this with just all rhubarb
raspberries any kind of fruit really to
that I'm going to add some lemon zest
about a teaspoon of grated lemon zest
freshly grated and then about a
tablespoon of the juice and some white
sugar so the filling for this the fruit
mixture really basic and yes I see that
piece of rhubarb on the board I will put
it in just relax it's bothering me too
all right so the fruit filling is ready
we're gonna go to the crisp top which is
brown sugar whole wheat flour oatmeal a
nice pinch of salt and just a hint just
a suggestion of cinnamon just a little
sprinkle I'm gonna cut in there slice in
there some whole butter cold butter
unsalted butter I'm gonna cut in the
butter with a pastry cutter you can use
it for you can use your fingers you know
if you like greasy sweet oatmeal under
your fingernails and really who doesn't
alright once that looks like that okay
the largest piece of butter is maybe the
size of a pea all right so we're gonna
take a greased which means buttered 2
quart baking dish pour in the fruit pour
on the topping even it out
and we're gonna bake that at 375 degrees
for about 35 minutes until it looks like
that which is beautiful all right now
traditionally this is served with
vanilla ice cream so yes I'm gonna make
you watch me put vanilla ice cream on
this look at that unbelievable and then
let's just meditate for about 10-15
seconds let's watch vanilla ice cream
melt into hot rhubarb crisp can't you
just feel the stress and anger melting
away what's that you're getting more
angry because you can't have any all
right that's it rhubarb crisp so easy a
classic American dessert if you've never
eaten rhubarb before this is the way to
eat rhubarb
it's got a great really interesting tart
flavor which works so perfectly with
that sweet crisp topping perfect
combination anyway I really hope you
give that a try go to the site to get
all the ingredients and as always enjoy
